column4: does anyone have experience correcting filesystems with errors?
right, except that everytime I run e2fsck it keeps telling me the fs has errors
you tried fsck -a? what is the output
I don't even know what the -a option is... I am using e2fsck besides
I'm not running that without knowing what it does
it's the same as e2fsck -p, actually
but I don't really know what "preen" means
then go off and read something that will convince you that it isn't bad. coz you clearly don't believe me
once you're convinced, and you've run it, and it doesn't work (if it doesn't rather), then come back and paste the output
I have been looking for information, but I haven't found any yet... if you happen to have a link handy that would explain to me what it does, I'd appreciate it
ok, I ran e2fsck -p despite still not finding out what it really does... see http://main.zgib.net/~mvd/fsck-error
looks like it. and you tried "e2fsck" without any options?
